refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq add personality Command creates a new personality. A default template will be created. This default templatie will be used for host plenary generation only if no personality templates have been defined within the template domain.

listitem.para: The name of the personality to create.
The name of the environment hosts belonging to this personality will live in. The valid environments are: prod, uat, qa, dev, infra.
The owner GRN of the personality to be created. Scripts should use the numeric EON_ID, the textual GRN is more suitable for humans.
This flag specifies if this personality require hosts to be clustered.
Short description of the purpose of this personality.

This option takes a name of another personality within the archetype. All parameters and feature bindings will be copied over from the copy_from personality to the new personality being created. Other mappings such as required services, service mappings etc are not copied.

If this flag is specified a special feature 'personality/config_override' will be included in the aqdb generated personality configuration template. This feature effectively pulls in config_override.tpl from the personality templates in the template domain, if it exists.

example.title: add a personality
example.programlisting: aq add personality --archetype aquilon --personality foo --grn grn:/some/grn
aq show personality --personality foo Host Personality: foo Archetype: aquilon GRN: grn:/some/grn Template: aquilon/personality/foo/config.tpl

example.title: add a personality with config override option
example.programlisting: aq add personality --archetype aquilon --personality foo --grn grn:/some/grn --config_override
example.para: This adds personality foo with config override option enabled.
example.programlisting: aq show personality --personality foo Host Personality: foo Archetype: aquilon GRN: grn:/some/grn config override: enabled Template: aquilon/personality/foo/config.tpl

example.title: add a personality as clone of other personality
example.programlisting: aq add personality --archetype aquilon --personality foo --grn grn:/some/grn --copy_from unixeng-test
example.para: This adds personality foo and will copy any parameters and feature bindings defined for personality unixeng-test to personality foo.
example.programlisting:
aq show personality --personality unixeng-test Host Personality: unixeng-test Archetype: aquilon GRN: grn:/some/grn Template: aquilon/personality/unixeng-test/config.tpl Required Service: service1 Required Service: service2 Host Feature: somefeat1 [post_personality]
aq show parameter --personality unixeng-test Archetype/Personality : aquilon/unixeng-test espinfo : { "function": "crash", "description": "Personality to test new features/os/etc", "systemgrn": "[\"grn:/some/grn\"]", }
example.para: After running the above commands parameters, feature bindings will be copied. Required services and other service mappings are not copied.
example.programlisting:
aq show personality --personality foo Host Personality: foo Archetype: aquilon GRN: grn:/some/grn Template: aquilon/personality/foo/config.tpl Host Feature: somefeat1 [post_personality]
aq show parameter --personality foo Archetype/Personality : aquilon/foo espinfo : { "function": "crash", "description": "Personality to test new features/os/etc", "systemgrn": "[\"grn:/some/grn\"]", }
